chapter.title: Install the Deployer Node
chapter.para: This chapter takes you through the steps of installing the CLM deployer node. If you want more in-depth instructions, see the Deployment Guide using Cloud Lifecycle Manager for Cloud 9.

section.title: Install and Configure the SMT Server
section.para: One way to provide the repositories needed to set up the nodes in SUSE OpenStack Cloud is to install a Subscription Management Tool (SMT) server on the Cloud Lifecycle Manager server, and then mirror all repositories from SUSE Customer Center (SCC) via this server.

note.para: This configuration is optional when deploying SUSE OpenStack Cloud. However for the purpose of this proof of concept, this procedure is a requirement.

step.para:
Install the SMT Server pattern.
$ sudo zypper in -t pattern smt

Before you create a local mirror of the repositories, you need appropriate organization credentials. You can get the credentials from Novell Customer Center or SUSE Customer Center (SCC), they are identical. For more information on SMT configuration, see the SMT Configuration in the SUSE OpenStack Cloud Deployment Guide.

Mirror the following repositories:
SLES12-SP4-Pool x86_64
SLES12-SP4-Updates x86_64
SUSE-OpenStack-Cloud-9-Pool x86_64
SUSE-OpenStack-Cloud-9-Updates x86_64

section.title: Install the Cloud Add-On

step.para: As the root user, open a terminal and enter the following to create the required directory: mkdir -p /srv/www/suse-12.4/x86_64/repos/Cloud
Copy the contents of the Cloud 9 installation media to the directory you just created.

Enter the following command to add the installation media and the Cloud install and update repositories from the SMT server to Libzypp:
zypper ar dir:///srv/www/suse-12.4/x86_64/repos/Cloud SOC9-Install zypper ar dir:///srv/www/htdocs/repo/SUSE/Products/OpenStackCloud/9/x86_64/product SOC9-Pool zypper ar dir:///srv/www/htdocs/repo/SUSE/Updates/OpenStackCloud/9/x86_64/update SOC9-Updates

Enter the following command to install the required pattern:
zypper -n in -t pattern cloud_user

section.para: The Ardana pattern should now be installed.

section.title: Set Password for User(s)

step.para: Use the following command to set the ardana user's password: passwd ardana
Use the following command to switch to the ardana user: su - ardana

section.para: You should now be logged in as the ardana user.

section.title: Copy SUSE Enterprise Linux ISO
section.para: Copy the SLES12-SP4 ISO image to the ardana user's home directory naming it sles12sp4.iso. The ISO is now be in the ardana user's home directory. This will be used when performing Cobbler based installs of the cloud nodes.

section.para: There are two methods for installation to choose from:
